required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Spinal Fentanyl or Epidural Analgesia in the Early First Phase of Induced Labor
clinical_study.official_title: Spinal Fentanyl or Epidural Analgesia in the Early First Phase of Induced Labor

brief_summary.textblock:
A total of 60 parturients undergoing induction of labour will be consented to participate in the study where they will be randomized to receive either spinal fentanyl (20 µg) or epidural analgesia (fentanyl 100µg and lidocaine 80 mg).
They will be monitored for the development of analgesia for a duration of 30 minutes.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 60 parturients randomized to two different treatment arms (30 in each group)
study_design_info.masking_description: The parturient and the midwife as well as the researcher doing the interview for analgesia will be masked. The anesthesiologist performing either spinal fentanyl administration or epidural analgesia will not be masked

primary_outcome.description: Reduction of visual analog scale (VAS) pain during contraction from pre-intervention value. 0 mm means no pain while 100 mm means worst possible pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time until pain returns to 60 mm VAS
secondary_outcome.description: Time from intervention until the maximum pain during contraction return to 60 mm on VAS scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Ambulation during the analgesia provided by the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: HAs the parturient been walking during the analgesia provided by the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the cardiotocography (fetal heart rate) within 30 minutes after the intervention

secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of pruritus within 30 minutes after the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: SAtisfaction of the parturient with the analgesia provided by the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: On 0-100 mm visual analog scale (VAS). Where 0 means no satisfaction at all and 100 mm means maximum satisfaction.

arm_group.description: Using a combined spinal epidural technique a single dose of 20 µg of fentanyl diluted into 2 ml with NaCl 0.9 % will be injected into the CSF at lower lumbar interspace. An epidural catheter is left in place for subsequent analgesic doses.

Using a catheter in the epidural space in the lower lumbar interspace a single dose of lidocaine (80 mg) and fentanyl (100 µg) is given. The epidural catheter is left in place for subsequent analgesic doses.

intervention.description: Fentanyl citrate 20 µg in 2 ml of saline injected into csf
Fentanyl citrate 100µg and lidocaine hydrochloride 80 mg in 10 ml volume
Fentanyl citrate 100µg and lidocaine hydrochloride 80 mg in 10 ml volume

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Signs a consent form to participate voluntarily into the trial
2. Induced labor
3. singleton pregnancy
4. primiparous
5. BMI 20-40 at the time of delivery
6. No history of allergy for lidocaine or fentanyl
7. sufficient command of Finnish language to understand the consent form and interview
8. Cervical dilatation at maximum 4 cm at the time of intervention
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any contraindication for spinal or epidural analgesia
2. Allergy for lidocaine or fentanyl
3. The patient has received any opioid medication within 90 minutes prior to intervention

eligibility.gender_description: All recruited patients are parturients undergoing induction of labor
